mapper.select:
select a.city_name, a.city_code,a.county_name, a.county_code,a.grid_name, a.grid_id,
IFNULL(sum(b.login_cnt),0) as loginTotalCount, count(DISTINCT(b.mobile)) as loginPersonTotalCount,
sum(if(a.role_id = 1, b.login_cnt, 0)) as gridCaptainLoginCount, count(DISTINCT(if(a.role_id = 1, b.mobile, NULL))) as gridCaptainLoginPersonCount, sum(if(a.role_id = 2, b.login_cnt, 0)) as gridManagerLoginCount, count(DISTINCT(if(a.role_id = 2, b.mobile, NULL))) as gridManagerLoginPersonCount, sum(if(a.role_id = 3, b.login_cnt, 0)) as businessHallLoginCount, count(DISTINCT(if(a.role_id = 3, b.mobile, NULL))) as businessHallLoginPersonCount, sum(if(a.role_id = 4, b.login_cnt, 0)) as decoratorLoginCount, count(DISTINCT(if(a.role_id = 4, b.mobile, NULL))) as decoratorLoginPersonCount, sum(if(a.role_id = 5, b.login_cnt, 0)) as directSellerLoginCount, count(DISTINCT(if(a.role_id = 5, b.mobile, NULL))) as directSellerLoginPersonCount, sum(if(a.role_id = 6, b.login_cnt, 0)) as agentBusinessLoginCount, count(DISTINCT(if(a.role_id = 6, b.mobile, NULL))) as agentBusinessLoginPersonCount, sum(if(a.role_id = 7, b.login_cnt, 0)) as operatingPersonnelLoginCount, count(DISTINCT(if(a.role_id = 7, b.mobile, NULL))) as operatingPersonnelLoginPersonCount
from (select mobile, city_name,city_code, county_name, county_code, grid_name, grid_id,role_name, role_id from t_user_grid_role) a LEFT OUTER JOIN (select mobile, count(*) as login_cnt from t_user_operate_log${tableIndex} where type = 1 and operate_time >= #{startTime} and operate_time <= #{endTime} group by mobile)b on a.mobile = b.mobile group by a.city_code, a.county_code
